metadata.title: CVE-2012-6637 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Apache Cordova 3.3.0 and earlier and Adobe PhoneGap 2.9.0 and earlier donot anchor the end of domain-name regular expressions, which allows remoteattackers to bypass a whitelist protection mechanism via a domain name thatcontains an acceptable name as an initial substring.

criterions.comment: cordova-ubuntu: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
